contents.context:
Relief money from the government will now be available for freelancers and other people not covered by employment insurance for example, home tutors, translators and gym teachers, to name a few.
The labor ministry made the announcement Thursday at an emergency meeting on the economy.
The one-time payments will be worth more than 12-hundred U.S. dollars, and are expected to benefit some 930-thousand people.
To be eligible, you have to make less than about 57-thousand U.S. dollars a year, or have a household income less than 150 percent of the average.
You also have to prove a decrease in your income from March to April, though the standards for the decrease differ depending on income size.
Reporter : jychoi@arirang.com
contents.headline:
S. Korea to provide US$ 1,220 payment to workers not covered by employment insurance
Updated: 2020-05-07 17:23:05 KST

contents.context:
Hungary is allowing entry to South Koreans for business without requiring special quarantine measures. According to an official at Seoul's Foreign Ministry on Thursday, the Hungarian government said that effective April 30th, it is permitting entry to businesspeople from six countries including Korea, the Czech Republic, and Germany.
Meanwhile, 252 LG Group employees entered Nanjing, China on Sunday through the newly-established 'fast-track' entry system for business travelers.
They have all been screened for COVID-19 and once their results come back as negative, they will start work on Friday.
Reporter : jy_rachel@arirang.com
contents.headline:
Hungary allows entry to businesspeople from 6 countries including S. Korea
Updated: 2020-05-07 17:16:38 KST

contents.context:
Small domestic businesses are having difficulty entering overseas markets
Conducting export consultations with foreign buyers through video
EWG(Environmental Working Group) Green . .
It is EWG Green Grade. It doesn't have any synthetic fragrances or artificial ingredients.
Intense video consultation
Strategic Exhibition Team, KOTRA
We are facilitating a matching program to help domestic businesses struggling due to COVID-19 find overseas buyers.
In sync with the government's policies to boost the economy,
we plan to provide more and more video consulting equipment to local support group facilities.
Local businesses hope to overcome COVID-19
and stand out in the global market with their brand power
Reporter : cinejenna910@naver.com
contents.headline:
VJ Video Export Consulting
Updated: 2020-05-07 17:12:51 KST

contents.context:
Since receiving emergency use authorization from the Ministry of Food and Drug Safety in March, local COVID-19 testing kit producer BioSewoom has seen demand for its products increase, both at home and abroad.
Amid the COVID-19 pandemic, South Korean biotech companies have been gaining much attention for their high quality, accurate products.

"Our test kits are currently being used in Daegu, Seoul and other local hospitals. We have been exporting our products overseas, to Russia, India, Myanmar and other countries. Demand has also been high for sample kits and research documents."

Other local test kits that have been approved for emergency use by the drug safety ministry include those made by Seegene, Solgent, Kogenebiotech and SD Biosensor.
According to the Korea Customs Service, as of April 20th, almost 157-million U.S. dollars of COVID-19 test kits have been exported, and they have been sold to 106 countries.

Korean bio-tech research and development is also in the spotlight.
Local contract research organization Knotus conducts non-clinical testing for developing new medicines, and it has seen an increase in orders.

"Since COVID-19 has been relatively less severe in South Korea, we have been receiving a lot of orders for non-clinical testing from overseas, especially from the U.S. and France, where there have been mass shutdowns."

South Korea has seen exports of its biohealth products, COVID-19 test kits and other virus prevention equipment jump 29-percent in April from a year earlier.
Demand is particularly high from Europe, the U.S. and other regions that have been hit hard by the pandemic.

“Experts say there is high demand for Korean biotech and healthcare products because of their good quality and stable supply. They expect demand from overseas markets to increase even after the COVID-19 pandemic.
Yoon Jung-min, Arirang News."
Reporter : yoonjm@arirang.com
contents.headline:
S. Korean biotech, healthcare products see increasing demand amid pandemic
Updated: 2020-05-07 17:09:38 KST

contents.context:
The basic policy direction for the Korean "New Deal" has now been unveiled.
The South Korean government says the project forged to revitalize the South Korean economy after the coronavirus pandemic will be focused on creating a sustainable job market and speeding up the digitalization of the economy.
The announcement came after an emergency economic council meeting on Thursday.

"The 'New Deal' project focuses on three main sectors: building digital infrastructure such as AI for innovative growth, fostering the non-contact services industry for the post-COVID-19 era, and digitalizing Social Overhead Capital by introducing a smart management system for roads and railways."

The government unveiled specific key areas to promote, mainly centered on 5G telecommunication and artificial intelligence.
The government says these 10 initiatives have the potential to create sustainable jobs.
It also says it will speed up large-scale innovation projects that focus on these areas over the next two to three years.
The government will also establish an AI-based remote learning platform, and expand remote medical services.
Details on how the 'New Deal' project will be carried out will be announced next month.
The funding would come from a third emergency budget currently being drafted, and from annual budgets through 2022.
Kim Jae-hee, Arirang News.
Reporter : jhee@arirang.com
contents.headline:
S. Korean gov't to speed up digitalization of economy with Korean 'New Deal'
Updated: 2020-05-07 17:09:38 KST

contents.context:
The European Union revealed what everyone had been expecting Wednesday -- that its economic forecast is intensely grim.
The COVID-19 pandemic has caused economic activity in EU to drop by around a third since the onset of the outbreak and resulting mass lockdowns.

(English - ) Reuters 3181 00:10 -
"It is now quite clear that the EU has entered the deepest economic recession in its history."

The European Union predicts its economy to contract 7.4 percent this year.
The COVID-19 outbreak has impacted nearly all economic sectors and has caused unemployment to skyrocket.
The EU anticipates its jobless rate to surge from 6.7 percent in 2019 to 9 percent this year.

(English - ) Reuters 3181 02:01 -
"Unemployment is set to increase though policy measures should limit its rise. The impact of the pandemic will be felt on the labor market."

The commissioner said there will be more job losses, but member governments and EU institutions will work on policy measures to cushion the damage.
The 27-nation bloc will experience different levels of economic shock depending on the respective member nation's situation -- like the period of lockdown and their financial status.
Italy and Spain, two of the hardest-hit EU countries, are forecast to experience the most intense economic struggles since their unemployment rates were already high and both of their national economies heavily rely on tourism.
Officials say the EU as a whole will have to face enormous economic losses in 2020 before rebounding around six percent next year.
Jang Tae-hyun, Arirang News.
Reporter : tommyjang@arirang.com
contents.headline:
EU forecasts deepest recession since the Great Depression in 1930s
Updated: 2020-05-07 17:00:54 KST

contents.context:
According to the Korea Customs Service, the country's total test kit exports last month amounted to more than 2 hundred million U.S. dollars, or 8 times the month before.
The kits were exported to 103 countries.
The one that imported the most was Brazil, accounting for 13 percent of the total, followed by Italy, India and the U.S.
Reporter : jychoi@arirang.com
contents.headline:
S. Korea shipped US$ 201 mil. in COVID-19 test kits in April to 103 countries
Updated: 2020-05-07 14:04:01 KST

contents.context:
Time now for an in-depth look at the market news this afternoon.
And for that, I'm joined on the line by Dr. Kim Sei-wan, professor of economics at Ewha Womans University.
Professor Kim, thank you for making time today.

Thank you.

The U.S. lost 20 million jobs in the month of April. Investors and others are apparently quite divided on what to make of the situation. What's your take, Professor Kim?

Things are tense again between the U.S. and China, trading blame for the pandemic. There are concerns this could spill over into the trade situation that they'd put to rest for a while late last year. What are the concerns there, and what's your view?

The U.S. jobs situation would've had an effect on the markets one way or the other. What's the story today in stocks?

Korea's main stock index closed flat today. But the tech-heavy KOSDAQ was strongly higher. Take us through the Korean markets.

Despite the pandemic weighing on trade in many respects, Korea posted an even bigger current account surplus for March. how did that happen, and what does it mean for the Korean economy?

Thank you, Professor Kim.
Reporter : devin@arirang.co.kr
contents.headline:
In-depth: Global market wrap-up
Updated: 2020-05-07 13:28:51 KST

contents.context:
Let's begin with South Korea's big plans for the country post-COVID-19.
It's being called the Korean 'New Deal', and it will focus on the digitalizing the economy to keep pace with the ever-changing world.
Let's take a look at what a senior finance ministry official said on the matter this morning during an emergency economic council meeting.

"The South Korean government will carry out a Korean version of the 'New Deal' that focuses on creating a sustainable job market and speeding up the digitalization of the economy. The 'New Deal' project will include innovation in the following three sectors: building digital infrastructure, fostering non-contact industries for the post-COVID-19 era, and a smart management system for roads and railways."

The government says it will speed up large-scale innovation projects based on the country's strengths such as ICT, and come up with results in two to three years.
The government plans to announce concrete measures for the "New Deal" project next month.
Reporter : jhee@arirang.com
contents.headline:
S. Korean gov't to carry out country's 'New Deal' project, focusing on digital-based job market
Updated: 2020-05-07 10:39:53 KST

contents.context:
South Korea's finance chief says the month of May will be a golden time for the South Korean economy to start recovering from the COVID-19 crisis.
Speaking at an emergency economic council meeting on Thursday, Finance Minister Hong Nam-ki said the government plans to pour all its efforts and means to prepare for life post-pandemic.
That includes unveiling a Korean version of the 'New Deal' that focuses on creating a digital-based job market and speeding up the digitalization of the economy.
In addition to providing around 410 U.S. dollars each to some 930-thousand freelancers in South Korea, the government will soon allocate its third COVID-19-related supplementary budget and set its economic roadmap for the second half of 2020.
Reporter : damikim@arirang.com
contents.headline:
S. Korean gov't to unveil country's 'New Deal,' focusing on digital-based job market: Minister
Updated: 2020-05-07 10:07:09 KST

contents.context:
As people around the world use laptops more and more amid social distancing and working from home, one leading U.S. consumer magazine gave its picks for the best laptops of this year.
LG Gram by LG Electronics has been selected by Consumer Reports as one of the best laptops of the year
The evaluators were particularly impressed by the 14-inch device and praised its high level of performance, powered by an intel core i5 processor, despite the model weighing less than one kilogram.
The magazine has previously picked LG Gram as its Best Laptop of 2019.
Reporter : ashin@arirang.co.kr
contents.headline:
LG Gram laptop on list of best laptops of 2020
Updated: 2020-05-07 10:06:10 KST

contents.context:
South Korean mobile giant Kakao Corporation posted record sales in the first quarter thanks to increasing demand for its services during the COVID-19 outbreak.
Kakao announced Thursday that its sales for January to March jumped 23 percent on-year to over 707-million U.S. dollars.
Its operating profit for the same period soared 219 percent from a year ago to over 71-million dollars.
Its mobile messaging app, KakaoTalk performed especially well, as did new businesses including mobile payment service Kakao Pay.
Reporter : yoonjm@arirang.com
contents.headline:
Mobile giant Kakao's Q1 earnings soar
Updated: 2020-05-07 10:04:03 KST
